intro: Synurus deltoides, commonly known as the delta synurus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic species. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as marshes and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
